synopsis: In this enlightening episode titled 'Anxiety', hosts Devam and Ahir engage in a heartfelt discussion about their personal experiences with anxiety, exploring its various manifestations and the importance of emotional expression. They share insights on how to cope with anxiety, emphasizing the significance of self-compassion and the value of open dialogue in breaking down mental health barriers.
quotes: The hardest part is accepting that this is an illness I have to deal with for the rest of my life, but it doesn't mean it can't get better.
It's so easy to dismiss yourself and feel hopeless, but the path to healing is long and filled with growth.
Sometimes, I feel like my anxiety is a fog, and beneath it lies the voice of reason that I need to uncover.
We need to embrace our sadness; it's okay to feel grief and express it.
Anxiety can sometimes feel like guerrilla warfare, constantly changing and morphing to hide from my conscious awareness.
If you don't trust yourself to deal with the worst, you will always jump to the worst-case scenario.
Every time you engage with your anxiety, it gets a little easier to roll that boulder up the hill.
Our feelings are how we engage with the world; they are not something to be dismissed.
When we avoid our problems, we only give them more power over us.
The journey of self-discovery is not about becoming perfect; it's about learning to love yourself in all your imperfections.
